intro: Vilfa ciliata, commonly known as the fringed vilfa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely toothed or fringed leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of Europe and Asia, often found in meadows and woodland edges. Vilfa ciliata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and mild aromatic properties.
